entries.title: Rupert Murdoch calls off proposed Fox-News Corp merger
entries.description: Rupert Murdoch had been exploring a reunion of Fox and News Corp about 10 years after he split the companies.

entries.title: Microsoft beats on earnings as cloud unit shows strong growth
entries.description: Microsoft saw a slowdown in Azure growth during a quarter in which it took a $1.2 billion charge for layoffs, lease consolidations and hardware lineup changes.

entries.title: Are digital wallets safe? Here’s what to know as the battle between big banks and Apple Pay heats up
entries.description: Competition over your digital wallet is heating up, yet peer-to-peer payments still have varying degrees of consumer protections.

entries.title: Senators slam Live Nation over Ticketmaster's dominance, botched Taylor Swift sale
entries.description: Criticism of Live Nation, which owns Ticketmaster, intensified after a botched sale of tickets to Taylor Swift's Eras Tour.

entries.title: NYSE's Tuesday trading glitch explained — Why some of the trades may be busted
entries.description: Dozens of stocks opened at prices well above or below their prior day closing prices. Most were halted shortly after the open.

entries.title: DOJ files second antitrust suit against Google, seeks to break up its ad business
entries.description: The lawsuit targets Google's advertising business and comes after reports that DOJ antitrust chief Jonathan Kanter had been cleared to work on Google.

entries.title: Classified documents found at Mike Pence's home in Indiana
Putin's nuclear threats move Doomsday Clock closest ever to Armageddon, atomic scientists say
entries.description: The 2023 countdown time on the clock is "90 seconds to midnight," 10 seconds closer to "doomsday" than it had been set at last year.

entries.title: New technique from U.S. national lab promises to strip carbon dioxide emissions from power plants and factories at record-low cost
entries.description: Scientists at the Pacific Northwest National Lab have developed a technique that can pull carbon dioxide out of a factory flue for $39 per ton.

entries.title: Walmart raises minimum wage as retail labor market remains tight
entries.description: The nation's largest private employer is raising its minimum wage to $14 an hour for store employees.

entries.title: NYSE says trading issue that led to dozens of stocks being halted has been resolved
entries.description: The major stocks impacted included Morgan Stanley, Verizon, AT&T, Nike and McDonald's, according to the NYSE's website.

entries.title: Oscar nominations: 'Everything Everywhere All at Once,' 'Top Gun: Maverick' among leaders
entries.description: The Academy Awards ceremony will be held March 12.

entries.title: Brits are being paid to cut power use, as cold snap threatens supply
entries.description: Households and businesses earn pounds per kilowatt of energy saved during peak times, as temperatures plunge and wind power drops.

entries.title: Greedflation: 'Entirely possible' that food brands are profiteering from price hikes, says Tesco chairman
entries.description: As inflation continues to push up grocery bills, British supermarket chain Tesco has warned that some food producers may be taking advantage of the situation.

entries.title: Finland says a 'time-out' is needed in talks with Turkey over Nordic NATO membership
entries.description: Accepting a new NATO member state requires unanimous consent of all 30 current members; Turkey is the one member most vocally opposing the new accession.

entries.title: North Korea-linked hackers behind $100 million crypto heist, FBI says
entries.description: The FBI said that Lazarus Group and APT38, two hacking groups linked to North Korea, were responsible for the attack on the Horizon bridge last year.

entries.title: When it comes to the energy transition, one analyst sees the market making a big mistake
entries.description: The comments, from Lombard Odier's head of sustainability research, were made during a discussion at the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland.

entries.title: Qatar doubles Credit Suisse stake as embattled lender forges ahead with strategic overhaul
entries.description: The Qatar Investment Authority is now the second-largest shareholder in Credit Suisse after doubling its stake in the embattled Swiss lender late last year.

entries.title: Germany resists intense pressure over tanks for Ukraine, saying 'the situation has not changed'
entries.description: Germany has again refused to commit to allowing German-made tanks to be sent to Ukraine despite intense pressure.

entries.title: Aramco-backed fintech opens bank branch in London to help Muslims invest
entries.description: Wahed, an Islamic fintech startup backed by Saudi Aramco and Paul Pogba, debuted its own retail presence in the U.K. Tuesday.

entries.title: Argentina and Brazil are discussing plans for a common currency — analysts can scarcely believe it
entries.description: Argentina and Brazil are in early talks to create a common currency, as part of a coordinated bid to reduce reliance on the U.S. dollar.

entries.title: Amazon adds generic prescription perk for Prime members
entries.description: The add-on, called RxPass, will allow Prime members to get as many drugs as they need from a list of 50 generic medications used to treat common conditions.

entries.title: The U.S. is massively underperforming global stock markets, and analysts see more of the same
entries.description: U.S. stocks have fallen far short of their global peers over the past three months, a rarity in recent years, and analysts expect this divergence to widen over the course of 2023.

entries.title: Right-wing Quran burning in Sweden enrages Turkey and throws a new wrench in Nordics’ NATO bid
entries.description: Sweden and Finland have worked to try and improve their relations with Turkey, but recent events have thrown fresh wrenches into any hopes for progress.

entries.title: D.C. appeals court expedites oral arguments in Grayscale lawsuit against SEC
entries.description: The D.C. Court of Appeals has scheduled a date to hear oral arguments in Grayscale's lawsuit contesting the SEC's decision to deny the conversion of GBTC to an ETF.

entries.title: Google CEO defends job cuts in animated town hall as employees demand clarity on process
entries.description: Google executives held a town hall meeting with staffers on Monday after the company announced its largest layoff in history.

entries.title: 7 dead, 1 injured in Half Moon Bay shootings; suspect in custody
entries.description: The San Mateo County Sheriff's Office said it took a 67-year-old suspect into custody without incident.
